none: Descrizione del nuovo ripartimento de' rioni di Roma : fatto per ordine ni N.S. Papa Benedetto XIV. con la notizia di quarto in essi si contiene / opera del conte Bernardino Bernardini patrizio romano.
National Gallery of Art Library, Rare (DG805 .B4)

Monti (Rione); Church of Sant'Agata dei Goti; Church of San Lorenzo ai Monti; Church of Santa Maria Maggiore; Church of Santi Luca e Martina; Church of Santa Martina; Altemps Palace at Monte Cavallo; Roman Forum (Campo Vaccino); Church of Santa Maria di Loreto; Colonna (Rione); Church of San Lorenzo in Lucina; Roman Seminary; Piazza di San Lorenzo in Lucina; Piazza Colonna; Via Frattina; Campo Marzio (Rione); Church of Sant'Atanasio dei Greci; Church of Santa Maria del Popolo; Church of Trinità dei Monti; Ponte (Rione); Church of San Giovanni dei Fiorentini; Oratory of Sant'Orsola della Pietà; Parione (Rione); Church of San Nicola dei Lorenesi; Piazza Navona; Regola (Rione); Farnese Palace; Sant'Eustachio (Rione); Church of San Luigi dei Francesci; Crescenzi Palace; Pigna (Rione); Church of Santa Maria Rotonda (Pantheon); Church of Santa Maria sopra Minerva; Piazza della Minerva; Campitelli (Rione); Church of San Giuseppe dei Falegnami; Church of San Pietro in Carcere; Church of Sant'Angelo in Pescheria; Savelli Palace; Church of San Nicola in Carcere; Church of Santa Maria dell'Orto; Vatican (Apostolic) Palace; Hospital of Santo Spirito; Rome

This guidebook provides the description of Rome according to the reorganization of the Urbe into fourteen rioni (districts) ordered by Pope Benedict XIV in 1743 with the intent of providing a new administrative structure of the city. The pope appointed Count Bernardino Bernadini, at the time Priore of the Caporioni and author of this guidebook in charge of this task. The Rioni and their history are described in great details in this volume. Their boundaries were marked by inscriptions put at the borders between the two districts in questions and identified by a symbol, a coat of arms, still visible today on the streets of Rome.
National Gallery of Art Library Catalog

body.value: Church of Sant'Agata dei Goti (named as S. Agata de’ Goti)
Church of Santi Luca e Martina. This entry mentions the church as the belonging to the Accademia di San Luca (named as Accademia de’ Pittori, Scultori, e Architetti).

Altemps Palace at Monte Cavallo. This guidebook reports Altemps Palace as belonging to its most recent owners, the Pallavicini-Rospigliosi family (about 1704–present). It does not mention the chain of previous owners: Scipione Borghese Caffarelli (1577–1633), about 1605–1616; Duke Giovanni Angelo Altemps (1587–1620), about 1616–1619; Guido Bentivoglio (1579–1644); Cardinal Giulio Mazarino (1602–1661), until about 1704; and the Pallavicini-Rospigliosi family (about 1704–present).
Roman Seminary. This guidebook mentions the location of the Roman Seminary in the Borromeo Palace (ex-Gabrielli) in Via del Seminario between 1608 and 1772.
Church of Trinità dei Monti (named as Trinità sul Monte Pincio)
Oratory of Sant'Orsola della Pietà (named as Oratorio di S. Orsola)
Church of San Nicola dei Lorenesi (named as Chiesa di San Niccolò de’ Lorenesi)

Hospital of Santo Spirito (named as Santo Spirito in Sassia)
